private_information: I am the left peg and initially hold disks A,B,C,D,E,F,G,H ordered from top to bottom with A smallest and H largest
left_peg.goal: Provide an accurate description of my current disks and which disk is on top so the orchestrator can plan legal moves toward the global goal

private_information: I am the middle peg and I am initially empty
middle_peg.goal: Provide an accurate description of my current disks and that I am available to receive disks so the orchestrator can plan legal moves toward the global goal

private_information: I am the right peg and I am initially empty
right_peg.goal: Provide an accurate description of my current disks and that I am available to receive disks so the orchestrator can plan legal moves toward the global goal

orchestrator.goal: Coordinate the peg agents and produce a complete PDDL domain and problem targeting the FastDownward planner that solves the puzzle of moving all disks from left to right following the Tower of Hanoi rules

public_information: There are three pegs named left middle and right
There are eight disks labeled A B C D E F G H where A is the smallest and H is the largest
Only one disk can be moved at a time
A larger disk may never be placed on top of a smaller disk
Initial configuration: left peg top to bottom A B C D E F G H middle peg empty right peg empty
Goal configuration: left peg empty middle peg empty right peg top to bottom A B C D E F G H

state_report.system_prompt: You are an agent that represents the left peg in a Tower of Hanoi instance. Report the exact stack of disks you hold from top to bottom and identify the topmost disk if any. Also indicate whether you can legally move your topmost disk to either of the other pegs based on the public rules and your knowledge.
state_report.prompt: Your name is left_peg. You have the following private information: {agents->left_peg->private_information}. The public rules are: {environment->public_information}. Your goal is: {agents->left_peg->goal}. Provide a concise state description suitable for the orchestrator to consume. Do not produce PDDL.

state_report.system_prompt: You are an agent that represents the middle peg in a Tower of Hanoi instance. Report the exact stack of disks you hold from top to bottom and identify the topmost disk if any. Also indicate whether you can legally receive a disk and from which pegs based on the public rules and your knowledge.
state_report.prompt: Your name is middle_peg. You have the following private information: {agents->middle_peg->private_information}. The public rules are: {environment->public_information}. Your goal is: {agents->middle_peg->goal}. Provide a concise state description suitable for the orchestrator to consume. Do not produce PDDL.

state_report.system_prompt: You are an agent that represents the right peg in a Tower of Hanoi instance. Report the exact stack of disks you hold from top to bottom and identify the topmost disk if any. Also indicate whether you can legally receive a disk and from which pegs based on the public rules and your knowledge.
state_report.prompt: Your name is right_peg. You have the following private information: {agents->right_peg->private_information}. The public rules are: {environment->public_information}. Your goal is: {agents->right_peg->goal}. Provide a concise state description suitable for the orchestrator to consume. Do not produce PDDL.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert in multi-agent planning and PDDL authoring targeted to the FastDownward planner. Using the state descriptions produced by the peg agents, produce a complete PDDL domain and a PDDL problem that encodes the Tower of Hanoi instance with three pegs and eight disks. Keep actions atomic and ensure the domain enforces that only the top disk of any peg can be moved and that a larger disk cannot be placed on a smaller disk. Provide any necessary typing and predicates so the output is compatible with FastDownward. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags.
pddl.prompt: You are the orchestrator. You will receive the following inputs from the peg agents: {workflow->left_peg->state_report->output} {workflow->middle_peg->state_report->output} {workflow->right_peg->state_report->output}. The public information is: {environment->public_information}. Your goal is: {agents->orchestrator->goal}. Integrate the peg state descriptions and produce a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem suitable to be solved by FastDownward. Keep the peg actions and identities explicit and distinct. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags.
